slackapi 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Parameters used in multiple functions

Source: R/000-shared.R
dot-shared-params.Rd

Reused parameter definitions are gathered here for easier editing.

Arguments

max_reqs

(integer) The maximum number of separate requests to perform. Passed on to nectar::req_perform_opinionated().

max_tries_per_req

(integer) The maximum number of times to attempt each individual request. Passed on to nectar::req_perform_opinionated().

pagination

(character) The pagination scheme to use. Currently either "none" (the default) or "cursor" (a scheme that uses cursor-based pagination; see Pagination through collections in the Slack API documentation. We do not currently support "Classic pagination".

per_page

(integer) The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the list hasn't been reached. Must be an integer under 1000.

req

(httr2_request) The request object to modify.

team_id

(character) Encoded team id to list channels in, required if token belongs to org-wide app.

token

(character) A bearer token provided by Slack. A later enhancement will add the ability to generate this token. Slack token are long-lasting, and should be carefully guarded.

...

These dots are for future extensions and must be empty.

Developed by Jon Harmon.
